Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of male figure wearing a headdress. Head only. Mould-made and hollow. Red slip or paint. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Probably made in Naukratis. See Roman fisherman parallel in Bolton Museum (1886.31.19).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.109) (Phase 1)
